structure: v. 1-? : Wisdom instruction or reflection on righteous living vs wickedness
v. ?-end : Conclusion with moral or trust in God
v. 1-? : Address for king's blessing or praise of king's rule
v. ?-end : Description of king’s just reign and outcomes
v. 1-? : Lament by the psalmist, expressing fear and plea for help
v. ?-? : Affirmation of trust in God’s protection
v. ?-end : Psalmist’s confidence and praise as God grants salvation
v. 1-? : Evening prayer, plea for God’s answer and safety
v. ?-? : Instruction to trust and avoid sin
v. ?-end : Psalmist speaks of blessing and peace for those trusting God
v. 1-? : Morning prayer for guidance and deliverance
v. ?-? : God’s righteousness contrasted with the wicked
v. ?-end : God’s protection for the faithful, condemnation of the wicked
v. 1-? : Petition for mercy and healing amid suffering
v. ?-? : Deep distress over affliction; plea for God’s attention
v. ?-end : Assurance of joy and relief as God saves the psalmist
v. 1-? : Cry to God as a refuge against false accusations
v. ?-? : Declaration of innocence and plea for vindication
v. ?-end : Appeal for divine judgment on wicked, ending with praise
v. 1-2: Exaltation of God’s name and majesty
v. 3-9: Reflection on God’s glory in creation and human significance
v. 1-2: Thanksgiving and praise for God’s justice
v. 3-6: Account of God’s judgment on enemies
v. 7-12: Call to praise God (Zion) for his righteous judgment
v. 13-20: Plea for help and remembrance of the afflicted
v. 1-3: Complaint that God seems distant as the wicked prosper
v. 4-11: Description of the arrogance and cruelty of the wicked
v. 12-18: Petition for God to act, uphold the weak, and punish the wicked
v. 1-3: Refusal to flee despite wicked counsel; trusting in God’s protection
v. 4-7: The Lord’s sovereignty and judgment; assurance that He loves justice
v. 1-2: The community cries out that godly men and women have vanished
v. 3-5: The psalmist criticizes deceitful speech and calls for God’s help
v. 6-8: God’s pure words are declared, promising He will guard the afflicted
v. 1-2: Arrogant questionings to God about how long sorrow will last
v. 3-4: Petition for God’s light and salvation
v. 5-6: The psalmist resolves to trust and rejoice in God’s salvation
v. 1-3: Description of the fool who denies God; all are corrupt
v. 4-7: God’s people pray for deliverance and mock the arrogant; righteous rejoice
v. 1-2: Introductory question and affirmation of who may dwell with God
v. 3-5: Description of the righteous person’s ethical conduct and reward
v. 1-4: Prayer of trust in God as refuge and keeper, rejection of false gods
v. 5-11: Affirmation of God’s portion, joy, and confidence in His protection and presence
v. 1-5: Prayer for vindication; affirmation of integrity
v. 6-9: Plea for God’s attentive ear and protection from enemies
v. 10-15: Description of the wicked; request for deliverance and vision of God’s face
v. 1-6: David’s cry for help and praise of the Lord as rock and deliverer
v. 7-15: Description of God’s mighty intervention (storm imagery)
v. 16-24: God’s rescue of David from enemies and rival Saul
v. 25-29: Reflection on God’s righteousness and guidance of a blameless life
v. 30-50: Praise for God’s complete deliverance; celebration of enemies’ defeat
v. 1-6: The heavens declare God’s glory and handiwork
v. 7-11: Exaltation of God’s law and its value for life
v. 12-14: Personal petition for purity and acceptance
v. 1-5: Priestly prayer for the king’s victory and blessings
v. 6-9: Nation’s confidence and appeal for salvation in the name of the Lord
v. 1-4: Celebration of the king’s strength granted by God
v. 5-9: The king’s joy in God’s salvation; plea for continued victory
v. 10-13: Confidence that God will exalt the king and punish enemies
v. 1-2: Heart-wrenching cry of abandonment by God
v. 3-5: Recounting God’s past faithfulness to Israel
v. 6-8: Suffering description and scorn of enemies
v. 9-11: Plea for God’s presence since birth
v. 12-18: Imagery of desperate encirclement and physical anguish
v. 19-21: Prayer for rescue from the mouth of the lion
v. 22-31: Transition to public praise; vow to declare God’s name to all generations
v. 1-3: The Lord as Shepherd providing rest and guidance
v. 4-6: Confidence in God’s presence through trials and promise of blessing
v. 1-2: Declaration that the earth belongs to the Lord and His holiness
v. 3-6: Those who may ascend the holy hill (pure and righteous)
v. 7-10: Call to gates to lift up eternal King of glory, concluding with praise
v. 1-3: Invocation of the Lord’s name as refuge and plea for remembrance
v. 4-7: Request for God’s guidance and forgiveness
v. 8-15: Confidence in God’s kindness; listing of those who follow Him
v. 16-22: Appeal for rescue from troubles and enemies
v. 1-3: Declaration of integrity and love for the Lord’s house
v. 4-6: Resistance to wicked company and love of God’s altar
v. 7-12: Confirmation of God’s goodness and plea for salvation
v. 1-3: Confession of trust in the Lord amid fear
v. 4-6: Desire to dwell in the house of the Lord
v. 7-10: Prayers for mercy and affirmation of God’s protection
v. 11-14: Final exhortation to trust in the Lord and be of good courage
v. 1-2: Plea for the Lord’s strength and response to the psalmist’s cry
v. 3-5: Contrast between the wicked and the righteous in God’s eyes
v. 6-9: Thanksgiving for God’s strength and protection of the righteous
v. 1-2: Call to ascribe glory to God and worship
v. 3-9: Description of God’s powerful voice in storm (theophany)
v. 10-11: Declaration of God’s enduring reign and peace for His people
v. 1-3: Thanksgiving for being lifted from the brink of death
v. 4-5: Call to praise because God’s anger is brief
v. 6-12: Personal testimony of despair and subsequent joy as God’s favor returns
v. 13-14: Vow to give thanks with music and praise forever
v. 1-5: Trust in God’s steadfast love and deliverance from enemies
v. 6-8: Praise for refuge, appeal not to let the faithful be ashamed
v. 9-18: Lament over suffering and pleading for God’s rescue
v. 19-24: Praise for God’s goodness and exhortation to love and fear the Lord
v. 1-2: Blessedness of forgiveness and covered transgression
v. 3-5: Confession of sin and relief of forgiveness
v. 6-7: Instruction to righteous to pray; God as hiding place
v. 8-11: Guidance promise; exhortation to rejoice in the Lord
v. 1-5: Call to sing a new song and worship with righteous praise
v. 6-9: God’s creative power (earth formed by word)
v. 10-12: God’s sovereignty and blessing on His people
v. 13-21: God’s watchful care over the righteous; prayer for mercy
v. 1-8: Personal declaration of praise; invitation to rejoice and taste the Lord’s goodness
v. 9-14: Advice to fear the Lord for protection
v. 15-22: God’s deliverance of the righteous and the righteous’ rejoicing; ultimate promise of justice
v. 1-3: Plea for God to contend with those contending against the psalmist
v. 4-8: Request for confusion of enemies’ plans; call on angels or Lord’s shield
v. 9-18: Declaration of praise as God delivers; complaint about deceitful enemies
v. 19-28: Vow to praise God for justice; desire for enemies to fall in disgrace
v. 1-4: Description of wickedness and arrogance of a man against God
v. 5-9: God’s steadfast love and faithfulness extending to all; light to righteous
v. 10-12: Call to trust in God’s justice, promise that God upholds the righteous
v. 1-11: Exhortation to trust God and do good, rather than envy the wicked
v. 12-20: Fate of wicked contrasted with inheritance of the humble righteous
v. 21-26: God’s care for the righteous; encouragement to trust in Him
v. 27-40: Final admonition to await the Lord; the wicked will be cut off, the righteous will inherit the land
v. 1-3: Cry of distress; recognition of God’s discipline
v. 4-8: Acknowledgment of physical and emotional suffering due to sin
v. 9-11: Isolation and despair; enemies rejoice
v. 12-22: Plea for pity and deliverance from enemies; confessing repentance
v. 1-3: Initial resolve to guard speech; reflection on life’s brevity
v. 4-6: Psalmist’s prayer about understanding life’s end; human life is transient
v. 7-13: Prayer for relief and acknowledgement of God’s patient correction
v. 1-3: Thanksgiving for rescue from pit and miry clay
v. 4-5: Blessing for those who trust in God
v. 6-8: God’s desire for obedience rather than sacrifice (possibly messianic)
v. 9-10: Declaration of praise and testimony to all
v. 11-17: Plea for continued mercy and judgment on evil men
v. 1-3: Blessing on those who care for the poor; the Lord’s protection
v. 4-6: Personal illness and plea for healing
v. 7-9: Envy and betrayal by enemies, even close friend
v. 10-13: Confidence in the Lord’s mercy and final praise
v. 1-4: Desperate longing for God (water-brooks imagery), hearing psalms taunts in captivity
v. 5-11: Dialogue with self – despair over absence of God, resolve to hope, and praise
v. 1-5: Petition to vindicate the psalmist, bring him to God’s altar
v. 5: Refrain of hope – trust and praise of God
v. 1-3: Recalling God’s mighty acts for Israel (history)
v. 4-8: Confidence in God as king and saving strength
v. 9-16: Cry of confusion: now God seems to hide His face; defeats and humiliation
v. 17-22: Questions of why God allows suffering if Israel was faithful
v. 23-26: Call for God to awake, avenge and save Israel
v. 1-2: Praise of the king’s beauty and words
v. 3-5: God’s power and justice on the throne
v. 6-9: Messiah-like imagery; joy and anointing with oil
v. 10-15: Address to the bride: beauty and royal presence
v. 16-17: Prosperity of the king’s line
v. 1-3: God as refuge and strength, unshaken despite earth’s turmoil
v. 4-7: City of God (Zion) has river, God in midst; nations in uproar but God’s help and holiness ensure peace
v. 8-11: Call to see God’s deeds, conclude that He is exalted among nations; the Lord of hosts is with us
v. 1-4: All nations clap and sing to God, who ascends with a shout
v. 5-9: God’s kingship over all the earth; tribes choose Zion for God’s dwelling; praise to God who reigns
v. 1-3: God is great; His city (Zion) is lovely, joy of the whole earth
v. 4-8: God has protected Zion; men flee in panic before the Lord
v. 9-14: Conclusion – a call to walk about Zion and recount her towers; trust in God’s protection and forever praise
v. 1-4: Call for all to hear an important message
v. 5-12: Riches cannot redeem life; death is fate of all, and the vain trust in wealth
v. 13-20: The downfall of the proud contrasted with God redeeming the faithful from the grave
v. 1-6: The Lord summons heavens and earth to a trial; Israel reminded of God’s greatness
v. 7-15: God’s complaint about lack of thanksgiving among His people; call to sincere worship
v. 16-23: Rebuke of the wicked who misuse sacrifices; call to repentance and heartfelt praise
v. 1-2: Plea for mercy and cleansing from sin
v. 3-6: Acknowledgement of sin and guilt; recognition of God’s righteousness
v. 7-12: Request for purification, restoration of joy, and right spirit
v. 13-17: Vow to teach sinners; description of desired sacrifice (contrition)
v. 18-19: Prayer for the prosperity of Zion and restoration after judgment
v. 1-4: Address to the arrogant man’s evil deeds and deceit
v. 5-7: Confession that the righteous await God’s judgment on the wicked
v. 8-9: Declaration of rejoicing in God’s steadfast love and strength
v. 1-3: All are corrupt; there is none who does good
v. 4-6: God looks from heaven; there is no one to seek Him, causing fear to increase; call for salvation for Israel
v. 1-3: Plea for God’s help against betraying enemies
v. 4-6: Commit petition to God as Him who vindicates the just
v. 7-7: Assurance of praise for deliverance
v. 1-3: Cry to God for help amid threats
v. 4-8: Turmoil of heart and desire to flee from trouble
v. 9-15: Confession of fear; lament over betrayal by a friend
v. 16-23: Trust in God for vengeance; call for mercy
v. 1-2: Plea for God’s mercy in distress
v. 3-4: Statement of trust despite fear
v. 5-11: Torment by enemies; decision to praise God and trust in His word
v. 12-13: Vow of thanksgiving for deliverance
v. 1-2: Prayer to God, highest refuge, to be honored above heavens and earth
v. 3-4: Cry for mercy in deep waters; enemies surround
v. 5-11: Praise as God displays mercy; vow to sing and give thanks among the nations
v. 1-5: Complaint about unjust judges who practice deceit and violence
v. 6-8: Call for God to break the teeth of the wicked and let them vanish
v. 9-11: Statement of hope that the righteous will praise God and the wicked perish
v. 1-3: Evening prayer for rescue from violent enemies
v. 4-8: Description of enemy plotting; confidence that God is above them
v. 9-13: Call on God to deliver; theme of God as strength of salvation
v. 14-17: Declaration that the righteous will rejoice in God’s protection and sing of His mercy
v. 1-5: Prayer to God about defeat in battle; appeal to show your power
v. 6-8: God’s promises as heritage to His beloved
v. 9-12: Petition for help against hostile nations
v. 1-4: Prayer for God’s shelter and protection under His wings forever
v. 5-8: Vow of praise and declaration of God as Rock and support
v. 1-2: Quiet assurance that God alone is rock and salvation
v. 3-5: Admonition not to trust in extortion or violence
v. 6-8: Reaffirmation of trust in God; exhortation to pour out heart before Him
v. 9-12: Contrast of those trusting in idols and fulfillment of God’s justice
v. 1-4: Thirst for God in dry land; praise for steadfast love
v. 5-8: Soul satisfied by God; contemplation on God’s presence; confidence in divine help
v. 9-11: Enemies will perish; God’s favor on the king
v. 1-4: Plea for protection from secret slanders
v. 5-7: Description of conspirators plotting evil
v. 8-10: Confidence in God capturing the wicked by their own schemes; vow of praise
v. 1-4: Praise for God’s forgiveness and acceptance of prayer
v. 5-8: God’s power over creation, including silencing the sea and rising mountains
v. 9-13: Depiction of God’s provision for the earth (rain, harvest) leading to praise
v. 1-4: Call to all earth and nations to shout to God
v. 5-12: Testimony of God’s power in mighty acts and trials
v. 13-20: Vow of thanksgiving and sacrifice after deliverance
v. 1-2: Prayer for God’s blessing and shining of His face
v. 3-5: Call for nations to praise God
v. 6-7: Affirmation that God’s justice and blessing are for all people
v. 1-6: Call for God to arise; praise God who led righteous exiles
v. 7-10: Acknowledgment of God’s care for the earth and the needy
v. 11-18: Victory of God; receiving of gifts by the captive
v. 19-23: Praise to God for daily care and strength
v. 24-27: Procession of kings, mention of tribes, safety, and temple personnel
v. 28-35: Universal call to sing praises to God and His awesome name
v. 1-12: Cry of anguish (soul in deep distress), noted hypocrisy, and misery
v. 13-18: Petition for rescue because of God’s fear, recalling God’s commandments
v. 19-21: Description of suffering and reproach; call to God to act
v. 22-28: Importunate curse upon enemies; prayer for God’s deliverance
v. 29-36: Praise in the assembly, God’s salvation and blessing even after suffering
v. 1-5: Urgent appeal for God’s help and shame of those seeking harm
v. 6-8: Confidence and praise of God for salvation
v. 1-8: Prayer for refuge, based on a lifetime of trust
v. 9-13: Plea for God not to forsake in old age
v. 14-24: A resolute commitment to continuous hope and praise
v. 1-8: Prayer that the king may judge with righteousness and bless the needy
v. 9-15: Vision of the king’s reign bringing justice to the afflicted and abundance to the land
v. 16-19: Blessing on the king and his people; eternal praise to God
v. 1-14: The psalmist’s frustrated observation that the wicked prosper despite their wrongdoing
v. 15-26: A shift in perspective (often in the sanctuary) leads to understanding God’s judgment and the blessing of closeness to God
v. 1-11: Community laments the destruction of the sanctuary by enemies
v. 12-17: The psalmist recalls God’s creative deeds as demonstration of His power
v. 18-23: Plea for God to remember His covenant and to rise up against His foes
v. 1-2: Declaration of thanksgiving and recognition of God’s appointed time for judgment
v. 3-9: The Lord pronounces judgment on the proud
v. 10-12: Exaltation of the Lord; prediction that all the righteous will praise Him
v. 1-3: God is renowned in Judah; He has broken the weapons of war
v. 4-6: Celebration in the city of God due to His awesome deeds
v. 7-10: The Lord’s judgment is known; nations bow before Him
v. 11-12: Call to God to awaken and judge among the peoples; rejoice in God’s might
v. 1-9: The psalmist’s anxious cry and complaint to God during distress, feeling abandoned and questioning
v. 10-20: Remembering God’s mighty deeds (especially the Exodus) leads to renewed trust and awe of God’s power
v. 1-8: Call to teach coming generations of God’s works
v. 9-39: Recounting Israel’s rebellion and God’s mercy in the wilderness
v. 40-55: God’s saving acts in Egypt
v. 56-72: Israel’s unbelief; God’s choice of David
v. 1-5: Lament over Jerusalem’s devastation and people killed; nations ridiculing
v. 6-10: Plea for God to pour out wrath and remember the afflicted
v. 11-13: Prayer for God to redeem and praise; closing with a vow to give thanks
v. 1-3: Plea for God’s shepherding (presence) to shine forth upon Israel like fire
v. 4-7: Recounting past deliverances; pleas for attention
v. 8-19: The vineyard of God (Israel) lamented over decay; plea for restoration and renewal
v. 1-3: Call to praise God with tambourine and harp
v. 4-5: Announcement of a solemn feast (Feast of Booths)
v. 6-9: God’s deliverance of Israel from Egypt; reminder to listen to Him
v. 10-16: Rebuke for hard-heartedness; promise of deliverance if they obey
v. 1-4: God presides in divine assembly; calls gods to defend the weak and poor
v. 5-7: Lament that gods act unjustly; recognition that they will die like humans
v. 8: Call for the Most High to rise and judge the earth
v. 1-4: Plea for God not to stay silent against hostile neighbors conspiring to annihilate Israel
v. 5-11: List of nations uniting against Israel
v. 12-18: Prayer to let them be confounded and perish as at Midian
v. 1-4: Longing for the courts of the Lord; blessing of those dwelling in His house
v. 5-7: Blessed are pilgrims; trust in God as a shade or refuge
v. 8-12: O Lord God of hosts as strength; turning of heart to Zion; prayer for blessing
v. 1-3: Reminder of past mercy to Israel; prayer to return and forgive
v. 4-7: Assurance of revival of righteous acts and salvation
v. 8-13: Vision of peace; righteousness and peace kissing; mutual flourishing
v. 1-4: Prayer for mercy, aid, and confidence in God’s name
v. 5-7: Praise of God’s goodness; declaration of love
v. 8-10: Testimony of God’s uniqueness and deeds
v. 11-13: Prayer for guidance and thanksgiving
v. 1-3: God loves Zion; foundational city; register of nations born in her
v. 4-7: Glory ascribed to Zion; blessed are those who dwell in her
v. 1-2: Call to God for help; confident prayer from youth
v. 3-9: Deep despair; cry for deliverance; sense of abandonment
v. 10-12: Feeling that God has rejected and not listened
v. 13-18: Continued plea; statement that the psalmist is like one dead
v. 1-4: Affirmation of covenant and faithfulness to David
v. 5-18: Praise for God’s deeds and oath to David; affirmation of God’s supremacy
v. 19-29: God’s election of David; promise of throne establishment
v. 30-37: Covenant conditions; promise of enduring throne if obey
v. 38-51: Complaint over apparent failure of promise; feeling of being rejected
v. 52: Liturgical conclusion of praise
v. 1-2: God’s eternity contrasted with human frailty
v. 3-6: Metaphor of humanity’s transience and God’s wrath
v. 7-12: Reflection on life span as vanity; prayer for wisdom in numbering days
v. 13-17: Plea for compassion and favor; desire for joy and the work of our hands
v. 1-4: Assurance of safety under God’s protection (refuge)
v. 5-13: Metaphoric protections (snare, terror, plagues, beasts); angels uphold
v. 14-16: God’s promise of rescue and long life to those who love Him
v. 1-4: Declaration that it is good to give thanks to the Lord, with music on a holy day
v. 5-7: Pride of the wicked contrasted with flourishing of God’s righteousness
v. 8-10: The righteous flourish; even in old age they bear fruit
v. 11-15: Exulting over the defeat of foes; proclamation of the Lord’s righteous works
v. 1-2: The Lord reigns, clothed in majesty and strength; eternal throne
v. 3-5: Creation praise – floods lifted, but the Lord is mightier; holiness of God
v. 1-7: Invocation of God’s justice against the arrogant oppressors
v. 8-11: Reminder of God’s knowledge of human folly
v. 12-15: Blessing of the person God disciplines and advice to seek His law
v. 16-19: Confidence in God’s help; comfort in the midst of trouble
v. 20-23: Plea for God to break the wicked; affirmation of God’s justice
v. 1-5: Call to praise the Lord for His greatness and creating power
v. 6-11: Exhortation to worship and obey; warning from Israel’s past disobedience
v. 1-3: Call for a new song and proclamation of God’s salvation to the world
v. 4-9: List of reasons to worship – majesty, strength, fairness, uniqueness, glory in nature
v. 10-13: Declaration of the Lord’s coming to judge; call for the earth to rejoice
v. 1-3: The Lord reigns; earth trembles at His presence; darkness and clouds around Him
v. 4-6: Lightning and hail scatter enemies; mountains melt before God
v. 7-12: The righteous rejoice; clouds and darkness around Him; call to righteous to love justice
v. 1-3: Call to sing a new song; declaration of God’s wonders and salvation
v. 4-6: All creation to make joyful noise and praise the Lord
v. 7-9: Announcement of the Lord’s coming to judge; call for earth to rejoice
v. 1-3: The Lord reigns; He sits enthroned above cherubim; calls for His great name
v. 4-5: Strength and justice belong to God; exalt Him for holiness
v. 6-9: Moses, Aaron, Samuel call to Him; He answered them; invite to praise God for mercy
v. 1-3: Call to all lands to make a joyful noise to the Lord; serve with gladness
v. 4-5: Enter His gates with thanksgiving; because the Lord is good and faithful
v. 1-4: David’s commitment to integrity and reject of evil company
v. 5-8: The wicked will be destroyed; the faithful would be close to David
v. 1-11: In my distress I cry out: pour out prayer; health withers; plea for God’s appearance
v. 12-18: Prayer for Zion’s rebuilding; God’s words eternal
v. 19-22: God looks with favor on Zion and the destitute
v. 23-28: Before God, nations will perish but not He; He is the ancient God
v. 1-5: Bless the Lord, who forgives sins and heals; compassionate and gracious
v. 6-14: God’s righteousness to those who fear Him; He remembers covenant; compassion
v. 15-18: Human life fleeting, but mercy on those who fear Him to thousands
v. 19-22: The Lord has established His throne; angels and hosts worship
v. 1-9: The Lord clothed with light; creation of heavens, earth, seas; God’s power in nature
v. 10-18: God provides water for beasts; trees flourish for birds and humans
v. 19-23: Sun and moon mark times; sea creatures praise Him
v. 24-30: Man’s work and God’s provisions, life renewed by God’s Spirit
v. 31-35: Prayer that the Lord’s glory endures; sinners perish; blessing of God’s praise
v. 1-6: Give thanks to God; seek Him; call on His name
v. 7-11: Remember covenant with Abraham
v. 12-15: Mention of Joseph; God’s rule over Pharaoh’s heart
v. 16-45: God’s faithfulness through Joseph, plagues, Exodus, wanderings, conquest
v. 1-5: Praise the Lord; desire to keep His testimonies
v. 6-12: Recount Israel’s rebellions (Egypt, Red Sea)
v. 13-23: Golden calf incident
v. 24-31: Rebellion in wilderness (Taberah, Massah)
v. 32-39: Further rebellions (Korah, Midian)
v. 40-48: YHWH’s anger and mercy; pray for salvation; boast in God’s people
v. 1-9: Call to thank the Lord who gathers the dispersed (4 scenarios of deliverance)
v. 10-22: Deliverance of prisoners and the sick
v. 23-32: Deliverance of sailors from storm
v. 33-43: Deliverance of nations from famine, drought
v. 43: Blessed is he who observes these things
v. 1-4: Declaration to sing and give thanks; heart is steadfast; awakening to praise
v. 5-6: Lists God’s qualities among peoples
v. 7-13: Prayer for the defeat of enemies; plea for God’s help in battle
v. 1-5: Plea for God’s help against lying enemies
v. 6-19: Imprecatory curses against enemies, including calling down the deceitful on themselves
v. 20-31: Vow of praise and trust in God’s salvation after enumerating suffering
v. 1: The Lord says to my Lord (Messianic) to sit at His right hand
v. 2-4: The Lord sends the rod of power to rule, priesthood of Melchizedek
v. 5-7: The Lord’s wrath and judgment; victory on the day of battle
v. 1-4: Praise for works of the Lord and His glorious power
v. 5-10: Description of God’s provision, justice, covenant, precepts, and fear; He is praised forever
v. 1-4: Blessing of the man who fears the Lord: his children, wealth, and generosity
v. 5-9: Description of the righteous as gracious, compassionate; assurance of their stability
v. 10: Contrast: the wicked see and are vexed
v. 1-3: Call to praise the Lord from sunrise to sunset
v. 4-6: The Lord is high above all nations; seated on heaven’s throne
v. 7-9: He raises the poor; sets the childless woman in a family
v. 1-4: Israel’s exodus makes the mountains leap
v. 5-8: The sea parts and Jordan turns back at God’s presence
v. 9: Mountains, etc., to tremble at the presence of the Lord
v. 1-9: Contrast of idols (worthless) vs. our God (creator)
v. 10-15: Trust of Israel and priests in God; blessing on those who fear Him
v. 16-18: The dead cannot praise; we will bless the Lord now and forever
v. 1-2: Personal declaration of love for the Lord who hears prayers
v. 3-7: Crisis of death; God’s salvation
v. 8-11: Return to rest; trust and waiting for help
v. 12-19: Vows to God (drink water, sacrifices of thanksgiving), with community hymn
v. 1-2: Short praise: all nations, all peoples, praise the Lord for His steadfast love and faithfulness
v. 1-4: Thanksgiving for God’s steadfast love; call of house of Israel
v. 5-14: Personal cries for help; God’s deliverance
v. 15-18: Praise in the assembly; God’s right hand brings victory
v. 19-29: The gates of righteousness; cornerstone of life; call to give thanks to God
v. 1-24: Blessed are those who follow God’s law (aleph–vav)
v. 25-48: Prayer for revival; delight in God’s decrees (zayin–teth)
v. 49-72: Assurance in God’s word (yod–yod)
v. 73-104: Understanding God’s law (kaph–tsade)
v. 105-144: God’s word as lamp and comfort (qoph–tav)
v. 145-176: Plea and praise in following the law (end of tav)
v. 1-4: The traveler’s cry for peace and truth in face of deceitful mouths
v. 5-7: The nemesis will receive suffering due to their violence
v. 1-2: I lift my eyes to the hills — my help comes from the Lord
v. 3-8: God watches over Israel; keeps guard day and night
v. 1-2: Joy in going to the house of the Lord
v. 3-5: Jerusalem as a unified city; invitation for all tribes
v. 6-9: Prayer for peace in Jerusalem and the flourishing of God’s people
v. 1-4: Lifted eyes to God, the enthroned mercy; plea for compassion from scornful look
v. 1-4: If God had not helped us, enemies would have swallowed us alive
v. 5-8: Glory to God who did not give us over to defeat
v. 1-2: Those trusting in the Lord are like Mount Zion, never shaken
v. 3-5: The wicked do not stand in judgment; peace on Israel; goodness on upright
v. 1-3: When the Lord restored Zion, we were like dreaming
v. 4-6: Plea for continued restoration; hope and rejoicing
v. 1-2: Unless the Lord builds the house, all labor is in vain; he gives sleep to children
v. 3-5: Children as heritage and blessing from the Lord
v. 1-2: Blessed is he who fears the Lord; prosperity for his children
v. 3-6: Wife as fruitful vine; peace on Israel
v. 1-4: Many afflictions but the Lord’s deliverance has prevailed
v. 5-8: May all who hate Zion be put to shame
v. 1-4: Out of depths I cry; confession that if You kept record of sins, no one would stand
v. 5-8: Waiting for the Lord; forgiveness and redemption in His word
v. 1-2: I do not occupy myself with great things; quiet and humble as a weaned child
v. 3: Israel, hope in the Lord now and forever
v. 1-5: Lord remember David’s humility; promises regarding the ark
v. 6-10: David’s oath about the ark; prayers that God hear and remember Zion
v. 11-18: God’s oath to David to set his offspring; promise for Zion and priests
v. 1: How good and pleasant it is when brothers dwell in unity
v. 2-3: Oil on Aaron’s beard; dew of Hermon on Zion; blessing of life forever
v. 1-3: Evening blessing of the Lord; priests who serve in the sanctuary
v. 3: The Lord from Zion bless you
v. 1-4: Praise the Lord; praise His name for good
v. 5-7: Praise to the Lord who remembers us; acts of the Lord in nature
v. 8-12: The Lord’s judgments on Egypt and redemption of Israel
v. 13-21: The Lord’s sovereign actions for Israel; contrast with idols
v. 1-3: Give thanks to the Lord (His mercy endures forever)
v. 4-22: Narration of God’s deeds (creation, Israel’s history) each ending with covenant refrain
v. 23-26: Thanksgiving as a result of God’s steadfast love
v. 1-4: Weeping by the rivers of Babylon as exiles; cannot sing Yahweh’s song
v. 5-6: Remember Jerusalem, voice for joy
v. 7-9: Impractical curses on Edom and Babylon, calling for vengeance
v. 1-3: I will praise You with all my heart; at the heavens; before divine assembly
v. 4-6: For Your steadfast love endures; You have exalted Your name
v. 7-8: The Lord will fulfill His purpose for me; praise forever
v. 1-6: God’s intimate knowledge of the psalmist
v. 7-12: Omnipresence of God
v. 13-18: God’s creation of the psalmist in the womb
v. 19-24: Impractical curse on the wicked; personal integrity plea
v. 1-3: Prayer for rescue from evil men and violent tongue
v. 4-6: The Lord God, strong shield; violence in their hearts
v. 7-9: Confidence in God’s justice; request to casting nets for enemies
v. 10-12: God is righteous; those who pray to You will inherit the land
v. 1-2: Prayer for God to hear and guide feet from evil
v. 3-5: Guard mouth, heart; do not let me lust after evil
v. 6-10: Call to God’s justice on wicked; deliver me from the evil man
v. 1-4: Supplication while in a cave; pouring out complaint
v. 5-7: Stated trust in God’s refuge; plea for release and people’s care
v. 1-4: Prayer for mercy, for I am in distress
v. 5-6: Prayer from a troubled soul; ask not to come into judgment
v. 7-10: Plea for God’s answer; guidance; sanctify me
v. 11-12: Thanksgiving for deliverance; acknowledge God as my rock
v. 1-2: Praise God who trains hands for war, fingers for battle
v. 3-5: What is man that God would care; human enemies and deliverance
v. 6-8: Weary calling to God; saving peace from enemies
v. 9-15: Desire for blessing (righteousness, safety, prosperity) on God’s people
v. 1-7: Exaltation of God’s greatness; mention of His works and wondrous deeds
v. 8-13: The Lord is gracious, compassionate; near all who call on Him
v. 14-21: God’s support of the righteous; faithful to all generations; call for all to praise
v. 1-2: Praise the Lord; trust not in mortal man
v. 3-6: God who made heaven, earth, does not falter
v. 7-10: God executes justice for oppressed; encourages widows and orphans; final: Zion’s King forever
v. 1-6: Praise is good; God builds Jerusalem; heals brokenhearted; great power
v. 7-11: Call to praise for good word; brooks; no delight in strength but in those who fear Him
v. 12-20: Praise Jerusalem; word of the Lord is perfect
v. 1-6: Praise from the heavens (angels, hosts, sun, moon, stars)
v. 7-12: Praise from earth (sea monsters, mountains, beasts, kings, youths, maidens)
v. 13-14: Israel praised for God; conclusion: praise the Lord
v. 1-4: Israel praises in dance and songs; God’s joy in His people
v. 5-9: Prophecy of vengeance on nations, executing justice on peoples
v. 1-6: Call to praise God with music and dance; everything that has breath praises the Lord
